text: today's you KITT manifesto underlines
all three of those priorities security
in the form of provision for 20,000
extra police officers 20,000 extra

it was quite right that campaigning in
this election ceased for 24 hours
yesterday but I believe it is the right
decision to launch our manifesto today
it is the duty of democratic politics to
confront the most serious issues of our
time and a general election campaign is
the most appropriate moment for those
issues to be debated it is also our
chance to send a message to those who
hate our way of life our values and our
democracy the message is clear you will
not win I was criticized by certain
sections of the media for calling
radical Islam a cancer in our society
following the Westminster attack I make
no apologies for saying this and I will
repeat it today it is a cancer that
needs to be cut out it is the role of
you kid in our national political life
to challenge the cozy establishment
consensus whenever it is failing the
British public we did that on
immigration control we did that on
brexit and now we will do any through it
by tackling issues surrounding
integration I want to make it clear but
I believe that anyone who leaves this
country to fight for Islamic state
should forfeit their passports their
citizenship and never be allowed to
return more police more soldiers more
prison officers and more bore the guards
are essential
there are many other things in our
manifesto today including something that
all of the other political parties would
love to be able to offer or cannot and
that is 11 billion a year spending
increase for the NHS and adult social
care by the end of the next parliament
that increase matches the reduction we
are pledged to make in foreign aid
spending we have laid out six key
breakfast tests that we feel need to be
met to ensure that we get the kind of
brexit that people voted for last year
UK is the country's insurance policy and
if the government begins to backslide
during these negotiations then it must
know that you kit will be there we will
